guys: why is my directory, "/usr/lib" have so many files?
its the location of all the libs that all your apps use
they can be used by more than one app which uses ram and hdd space better
uninstall unnecessary programs, if there are libs that no other app uses, it will be removed
what is the ouput of: lsb_release -c
hardy is slightly different but achieves the same end
to change the display use: gksudo nvidia-settings
in a terminal type: gksudo nvidia--settings
setup the display you desire, then click on "save to xorg.conf" your settings will now stick
you can use tab to complete commands
